location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to Government at Bombay Castle, to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter from Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to Government of Bombay, to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, transmitting a copy of a letter sent on the same day by Warden to R T Goodwin, Secretary and Translator in the Office of the Country Correspondence, forwarding a translation of a letter from Mahomed bin Sulama, Agent of the Wahabee [Wahhabi] Chieftain to the State of Muskat [Muscat], to Sir Evan Nepean, Governor of Bombay, dated 21 March 1814, suggesting that the British ships were to be distinguished by their colours and British people furnished with passports with the seal and the signature of the Governor, to avoid piracies by the inhabitants of Muskat [Muscat].
